message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.DB 

This paper discusses techniques for data fusion in information retrieval, which is a subfield of computer science that falls under the category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also mentions the use of machine learning techniques, which is a subfield of computer science that falls under the category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). However, since the focus of the paper is on information retrieval, we can rule out cs.AI as a likely sub-category. Within cs.IR, the paper specifically discusses techniques for probabilistic data fusion, which falls under the sub-category of Machine Learning for IR (cs.IR/ML). However, since the paper introduces a new technique that extends existing probabilistic data fusion methods, it is also likely to be relevant to other sub-categories within cs.IR, such as Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). Additionally, since the paper evaluates its proposed technique using experiments on real-world datasets, it may also be relevant to sub-categories such as Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Databases (cs.DB).
